The objective of this demo is to extract a time series of meteorological variables like temperature and precipitation in [Lima](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lima_Metropolitana) 
using  the dataset of [Terraclim](https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/datasets/catalog/IDAHO_EPSCOR_TERRACLIMATE?hl=en).

---
<img src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23284899/151858857-e98d6216-73be-4ffd-a95e-0b93fedbc0df.png" width="25px" align="center"><b> Information:</b>
- For this demo you need to have `rgee`, `sf`, `tidyverse` ,`lubridate`, and `patchwork` packages previously installed.
---

#### 1. Requirements

```{r,eval = FALSE}
library(rgee)
library(sf)  
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(patchwork)
ee_Initialize()
```
```
> ee_Initialize()
── rgee 1.1.2 ────────────────────────── earthengine-api 0.1.292 ── 
 ✓ user: not_defined
 ✓ Initializing Google Earth Engine:  DONE!
 ✓ Earth Engine account: users/ambarja 
─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── 
```

#### 2. Reading vector layer of study area
```{r,eval = FALSE}
lima <- st_read(
  "https://github.com/ambarja/gpkg-pe/raw/main/Lima_provincia.gpkg",
  quiet = TRUE) %>%
  summarise()
```

#### 3. Transformation of sf object to a feature collection 

```{r,eval = FALSE}
lima_ee <-  lima %>% 
  sf_as_ee()
```

#### 4. Cooking data with rgee

```{r,eval = FALSE}
terraclim <-  ee$ImageCollection$Dataset$IDAHO_EPSCOR_TERRACLIMATE$
  select(c("tmmx","pr"))$
  filterDate("1990-01-01","2021-12-31")$
  toBands()
# Extracting data
data <- ee_extract(
  x = terraclim,
  y = lima_ee,
  fun = ee$Reducer$mean(),
  sf = FALSE)
```

#### 5. Cooking data for mapping  
```{r,eval = FALSE}
data_prev <- data %>% as_tibble() %>% 
  mutate(region = "LIMA") %>% 
  pivot_longer(X199001_pr:X202012_tmmx) %>% 
  separate(col = name,into = c("date","variable"),sep = "_") %>% 
  mutate(date = ym(gsub("X","",date))) %>% 
  separate(col = date,into = c("year","month"),sep = "-") %>% 
  mutate(month = factor(month,labels = month.abb))
```

#### 6. Time series plot 

```{r,eval = FALSE}
data_prev %>% 
  filter(variable == "tmmx") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = as.integer(year),y = value*0.1, group = year, fill =  year)) + 
  geom_boxplot(color = "black",lwd=0.5,alpha=0.8) + 
  theme_minimal(8) + 
  theme(legend.position = "none") + 
  scale_fill_viridis_d(option = "inferno") +
  labs(x = "", y = "Temp")
```

  <img src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23284899/154715567-5a9ff726-8fe6-466e-bd30-fb636e1800bc.png" width="100%">

#### 7. Plots of temperature and precipitation

```{r,eval = FALSE}
newdata <- data_prev %>% 
  group_by(month,variable) %>% 
  summarise(value = mean(value,na.rm = TRUE)) %>% 
  spread(variable,value) %>% 
  rename(temp = pr,
         pp = tmmx) 

pp <- ggplot(newdata,aes(x = month,y = pp)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity",fill = "blue",alpha=0.5) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(x = "",
       y = "Precipitation [mm]",
       caption = "Source: TerraClimate")

temp <- ggplot(newdata,aes(x = month,y = temp,group = 1)) + 
  geom_line(color = "red") + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  labs(
    x = "",
    y = "Temperature[C°]"
  )

mapa <-  lima %>% 
  ggplot() +
  geom_sf(fill = NA,color = "black",lwd=0.5) +
  annotation_map_tile(zoom = 10) +
  geom_sf(fill = NA,color = "black",lwd=0.5) +
  theme(axis.text = element_text(size = 6))
g1 <- pp 
g2 <- temp 
mapa | g2/g1
```
